main event: Four civilians observed a V-formation of 7 to 9 orange-yellow lights moving rapidly across the sky in Bethesda, Maryland, on April 18, 1952.
interesting points: The objects were reported to be in a V formation with an included angle of 40 degrees., The lights were orange-yellow in color and uniformly sized., The sighting lasted between 4 to 8 seconds with no sound heard., The observers estimated the objects to be at an elevation of about 60 degrees., None of the witnesses had previously seen the Life Magazine article about a similar sighting.
